author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A timeless classic set in the opulent world of the 1920s, this novel paints a poignant picture of unfulfilled dreams and the hollowness of wealth. Through Nick Carraway's narration, readers are drawn into the enigmatic life of Jay Gatsby, a man chasing a lost love amidst the glitter of West Egg.

author: Harper Lee
review: An evocative tale set in the Deep South, this novel explores racial injustice and moral growth through the innocent eyes of Scout Finch. With Atticus Finch as the moral compass, it’s a moving portrait of empathy, integrity, and the courage to stand up for what’s right.

author: George Orwell
review: A chilling dystopia that envisions a totalitarian future where Big Brother watches your every move. Orwell’s haunting narrative critiques the dangers of surveillance, propaganda, and authoritarianism, leaving readers questioning the fragility of freedom.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A raw and introspective look into teenage alienation and rebellion, this coming-of-age story follows Holden Caulfield as he navigates a world full of “phonies.” It's a candid reflection on identity, loneliness, and the desire to protect innocence.

author: Jane Austen
review: Witty, romantic, and timeless, Austen’s masterpiece explores the complexities of love, social status, and pride. The spirited Elizabeth Bennet and the reserved Mr. Darcy remain one of literature’s most beloved couples, sparking conversations on first impressions and personal growth.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: An enchanting prelude to the Lord of the Rings saga, this fantasy adventure takes readers on a journey with Bilbo Baggins. From dragons to dwarves, it's a tale of courage, friendship, and the unexpected heroism of an unlikely adventurer.

bookName: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
review: The magical beginning of an epic saga, this book introduces readers to Hogwarts and the boy who lived. With themes of friendship, bravery, and destiny, it’s a captivating tale that sparked a worldwide phenomenon.

author: Paulo Coelho
review: A spiritual journey wrapped in a fable, this novel follows Santiago, a shepherd boy chasing his personal legend. It's a tale of dreams, destiny, and listening to your heart, offering profound lessons about life's purpose and inner peace.

author: Paula Hawkins
review: A gripping psychological thriller told through unreliable narrators, this novel keeps readers guessing until the final page. Exploring themes of memory, trauma, and obsession, it’s a twist-filled ride through a maze of secrets and lies.
